result.execSummary:
The defendant Timothy E. Anderson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Timothy E. Anderson is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Timothy E. Anderson was found guilty of Possession of THC [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

chargeModifiers.descr: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Timothy E. Anderson

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: For Ct 2 noly - Dismissed.
Acknowledgment of Plea Offer/Agreement

Attorney Jason Zapf appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in court in person and w/ Attorney Theodore Kmiec.  Clerk: MHerr.
MINUTES:  3:04pm-  Matter heard with co-defendants' cases.  Amended information filed.  DE acknowledges receipt & waives reading.  Matter is resolved.  Defendant entered a plea of guilty to count 1; found guilty by the court.  On the motion of the State, count 2 is dismissed.  Court orders a $250.00 fine plus costs & drug surcharge, due in 30 days or civil judgment.  NO DNA SURCHARGE.  Appeal rights given.

Special Prosecutor Attorney Jerrold Hinshaw appeared for the State.  Def. appeared with Atty Theodore Kmiec.  Clerk K. Zirbel.  State failed to subpoeana officers for today's evidentiary hearing.  Hearing reset for 5/21/15 at 1:30 (2 hours).  Bond continued.

Defendant, Timothy E. Anderson, appeared in court with Attorney Theodore Bernard Kmiec III who appeared by phone. Attorney Jason Robert Zapf appeared for the Prosecution. Clerk: N. Jurgens. 
MINUTES: Discussion held. Matter set for an evidentiary hearing.  Evidentiary hearing scheduled for April 28, 2015 at 02:30 pm.
Supplemental Motion to Suppress/Motion for Evidentiary Hearing from Unlawful Traffic Stop - filed by Attorney Theodore Kmiec
filed by Attorney Theodore Kmiec

*Not to Possess or Consume Alcohol.  *Not To Possess or Consume Controlled Substances w/o a Prescription.  *No Contact w/ Jack D or his residence.
961.41(1)(h)2 - Manu/Del THC /PTAC  946.49(1)(a) - Misd bail jumping

Attorney Jason Zapf appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in court in person and w/ Attorney Theodore Kmiec.  Clerk: MHerr.
MINUTES:  10:46am-  Matter heard with co-defendants' cases.  Attorney Kmiec advises the court that the defense attorneys are requesting an evidentiary hearing.  Discussion held.  Court will not set an evidentiary hearing at this time unless there is additional information.  If there is additional information, Court requests it be put in writing by motion - DE to file motion by 1/12/2015;  State to respond by 2/12/2015;  DE to reply by 2/20/2015.  DE orally motions for bond modification.  State waives notice requirement & takes no position.  Court modifies bond - DE may have contact w/ Sharon E.  All other conditions remain.  Motion hearing scheduled for March 4, 2015 at 02:00 pm.  Bond continued.
Final pre-trial on December 12, 2014 at 09:30 am.
Due to ongoing jury trial (State v. Cumberland), 10/28/2014 Final pre-trial is rescheduled to 12/12/2014 at 9:30am.  NTBS by the Court.
State's Response to Defendant's Motion to Supress - filed by ADA Jason Zapf
to Suppress - filed by Attorney Theodore Kmiec

ADA Jason Zapf appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in court in person and w/ Attorney Theodore Kmiec.  Clerk: MHerr.
MINUTES:  2:45pm-  Matter heard with co-defendants' cases.  DE is prepared to file a motion to suppress.  Discussion held re: the contents of the motion.  For reasons set forth on the record, Court adjourns matter to October 28, 2014 at 10:00 am.  Bond continued.

records.descr: Application for specific judicial assign approved

records.addlTxt: of Judge Schroeder filed by Atty. Kmiec and co-defs. Tab pulled for Judge Wilk (Br 7)

Attorney Jessica Krejcarek appeared for the State. Def. appeared in court with Atty. Ted Kmiec. Clerk LE.  Plea offer placed on the record by the State.  Prelim. waived, probable cause found. Request for substitution of Judge Schroeder filed by Atty. Kmiec and co-defs. Tab pulled for Judge Wilk (Br. &.) Bound over to Br. 7. Information filed, plea of not guilty. Judicial pretrial on 10-1-14 @ 2:30pm. Bond continued.
Preliminary Hearing Waiver/Plea Offer
to Preliminary Hearing
To cancel warrant.

1:26 pm    Attorney James Kraus appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in court in person and w/ Attorney Ted Kmiec.  Clerk:  LE.    Defendant requests preliminary hearing within 20 days; set before Comm Mason on 9-9-14 @ 9:45.  $2500 signature re-instated with continued conditions.

REINSTATED
  *Not to Possess or Consume Alcohol.  *Not To Possess or Consume Controlled Substances w/o a Prescription.  *No Contact w/Sharon E and Jack D or their residences effective at 8/20/14 @ 8pm.
961.41(1)(h)2 -Manu/Deliver THC (>200-1000G), PTAC   946.49(1)(a) -Misd BJ

227 p.m. Attorney Jennifer Phan appeared for the State. Clk  LE.  No appearance by defendant. Warrant Authorized. Cash bond set at $2500.00

2:10 pm    Attorney Patricia Riley appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney Ted Kmiec specially for today.  Clerk:  LE.    Initial appearance adjourned to 8-27-14 @ 1:00pm w/Comm Mason, 927-54th Street, Rm 157, Kenosha, WI.  re: Atty status.  Atty Kmiec moves to dismiss complaint.  Court denies motion.  $2500 signature bond set with conditions.
